title: Watering Succulents Right
description: Master the soak-and-dry method for your succulents.
steps: Water the soil thoroughly until water drains out.
Wait until the soil is completely dry before watering again.
Avoid misting the leaves; focus on the roots.
tips: Use a moisture meter to avoid overwatering.
Always use pots with drainage holes.

title: Best Soil Mix for Succulents
description: Create a well-draining soil mix to keep roots healthy.
steps: Combine cactus mix with perlite or coarse sand.
Avoid regular potting soil—it retains too much moisture.
Test your mix by watering and checking for drainage speed.
tips: You can add crushed granite or pumice for better drainage.
Store extra mix in a dry container for reuse.
Label your mix proportions for consistency.

title: Sunlight Needs for Succulents
description: Learn how much light your succulents crave.
steps: Place them near a bright, south-facing window.
Give at least 6 hours of sunlight a day.
Rotate the pot weekly to ensure even growth.
tips: If indoors, consider a grow light.
Watch for stretching—it means your plant needs more light.
Avoid sudden exposure to direct sun—acclimate gradually.

title: Winter Care for Succulents
description: Keep your succulents cozy and safe in the cold.
steps: Move them away from cold drafts or freezing windows.
Use grow lights if natural sunlight decreases.
tips: Group succulents to increase ambient warmth.
Ensure pots don’t sit in water—risk of rot increases.

title: How to Propagate Succulents
description: Grow new succulents from leaves and cuttings!
steps: Twist off healthy leaves or cut stems with a clean knife.
Let cuttings dry for a few days until calloused.
Place on well-draining soil and mist lightly.
tips: Be patient—roots may take 1–2 weeks to sprout.
Keep in indirect sunlight during propagation.
Don’t water heavily until roots are established.
